qoute: I have always been of the mind that in a democracy manners are the only effective weapons against the bowie-knife.
A man who pretends to understand women is ad manners. For him to really to understand them is bad morals.
A man's own good breeding is the best security against other people's ill manners.
Bad manners make a journalist.
Bedside manners are no substitute for the right diagnosis.
Ceremony is necessary as the outwork and defense of manners.
Clothes and manners do not make the man; but when he is made, they greatly improve his appearance
Frequent and loud laughter is the characteristic of folly and ill manners.
Good manners have much to do with the emotions. To make them ring true, one must feel them, not merely exhibit them.
I have always been of the mind that in a democracy manners are the only effective weapons against the bowie-knife.
A man who pretends to understand women is ad manners. For him to really to understand them is bad morals.
A man's own good breeding is the best security against other people's ill manners.
Bad manners make a journalist.
Bedside manners are no substitute for the right diagnosis.
Ceremony is necessary as the outwork and defense of manners.
Clothes and manners do not make the man; but when he is made, they greatly improve his appearance
Frequent and loud laughter is the characteristic of folly and ill manners.
Good manners have much to do with the emotions. To make them ring true, one must feel them, not merely exhibit them.
Liberty cannot be preserved, if the manners of the people are corrupted.
Manners are especially the need of the plain. The pretty can get away with anything.
Manners are love in a cool climate.
Manners are not idle, but the fruit. Of loyal nature and of noble mind.
Manners are the hypocrisy of a nation.
Manners easily and rapidly mature into morals.
Manners must adorn knowledge, and smooth its way through the world.
Manners require time, and nothing is more vulgar than haste.
Men's evil manners live in brass, their virtues we write in water.
Nowadays, manners are easy and life is hard.
Of course poets have morals and manners of their own, and custom is no argument with them.
Of Manners gentle, of Affections mild; In Wit a man; Simplicity, a child.
Opinions alter, manners change, creeds rise and fall, but the moral laws are written on the table of eternity.
Our manners have been corrupted by communication with the saints.
Prithee don't screw your wit beyond the compass of good manners.
Respect for ourselves guides our morals, respect for others guides our manners.
Savages we call them because their manners differ from ours.
Scientists have odious manners, except when you prop up their theory; then you can borrow money of them.
Sculpture and painting have the effect of teaching us manners and abolishing hurry.
Simplicity in character, in manners, in style; in all things the supreme excellence is simplicity.
Taste is more to do with manners than appearances. Taste is both myth and reality; it is not a style.
The greater the controversy, the more you need manners.
The hardest job kids face today is learning good manners without seeing any.
The test of good manners is to be able to put up pleasantly with bad ones.
They teach the morals of a whore, and the manners of a dancing master.
To the real artist in humanity, what are called bad manners are often the most picturesque and significant of all.
What once were vices are manners now.
You can't be truly rude until you understand good manners.
You lose your manners when you're poor.
